page.title: 03Housing_Morcombelake area.
page.content: The steep rise of Verriotts lane, N. of the A.35 road at Morcombelake, leads to some fourteen or fifteen individually designed houses, each one having grounds of half to one acre in extent. Many of the houses have been bought by newly retired professional people from other parts of England who much appreciate the natural coastal beauty of the area which is visible to the south from their lofty viewpoints. They develop their hobby as gardeners, making very attractive landscaped settings for their houses. The houses built on the highest point in the group lead to the heathland heights of Hardown Hill, over 600ft., which offers interesting walks along narrow paths amongst gorse and ling. The air is invigorating and the views both landwards and seawards are very attractive.
